title: SB 1.17.39 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 20-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janashalakaya
Chakshur Unmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we are discussing from the 39th verse of the 17th chapter of the 1st canto of Shri Madbhagavatam.
The meaning of this 39th verse is
The personality of Kali asked for something more
and because of his begging
King Pariksit gave him permission to live
where there is goal.
Because wherever there is goal there is also falsity, intoxication, lust, envy and enmity.
So, if you remember the previous verse Kali was given four places by Maharaj Pariksit
where gambling goes on, where drinking liquor is indulged in,
where there is illicit connection with women, prostitution and where there is animal slaughter.
Now Kali Purusha asked something more because at the time Pariksit was ruling
Kali Purusha could not find in Pariksit's kingdom any place where these four activities were going on.
So he asked for some place, some other place other than
the place where these four activities are sinful activities are indulgent and because the
kali purusha had surrendered to parikshit and he was begging for one more place some other place
the king gave him permission to live where there is gold
where this gold means where people have accumulated gold for
purposes other than devotional service other than for serving krishna other than krishna conscious
purpose if they have got gold accumulated in their home or in their state anywhere then that place
also parikshit gave kali purusha a place to reside why why was kali purusha a place to reside
given a fifth place because wherever there is gold which is not utilized for devotional service
there is also falsity intoxication lust envy and enmity these five things are there wherever gold
is accumulated and not utilized for uh devotional service so in the purpose shila prabhupada explains
although maharaj parikshit gave kali permission to live in four places
it was very difficult for kali purusha to find the places
because during the reign of maharaj parikshit there were no such places
this is called a perfect rule of a perfect king a pure devotee so during maharaj parikshit's
time during yudhishtira maharaj's time during the time of ambarish maharaj during the time of
all those great
kings who were ruling strictly according to the vedic injunctions and who was themselves
pure devotees then the entire kingdom there were no places where such sinful activities
were indulged in by anybody else therefore prabhupada says kali asked the king to give him
something practical which could be utilized for his nefarious purposes
Kali Purusha is described as Adharmabandhu, friend of Adharma, irreligion.
So, wherever Kali Purusha resides, he will spread Adharma.
And Parikshit Mahana did not want his citizens to get corrupted, to get influenced by Adharma,
Adharma influence of Kali.
So, therefore, Kali asked the king, you have practically cheated me.
You didn't give me any place.
So, then Parikshit Maharaj, because Kali had surrendered, he gave him a fifth place.
That place where gold is accumulated for non-devotional purposes.
So, Prabhupada says in the purport further,
Maharaj Parikshit thus gave Kali permission to go.
He gave Kali permission to live in a place where there is gold, because wherever there
is gold, there are all the above mentioned four things and over and above them there
is enmity also.
What are the four defects of accumulating gold for any purpose other than devotional
service?
There will be falsity, Andhritam, Madham, intoxication, Kamam, lust.
And enviousness, enviousness.
So, these four defects of accumulating wealth or gold for any purpose other than devotional
service.
These four things are there.
And also the fifth thing over and above these four, there is enmity also that will breed
among the family members or among the citizens of the state or among the members of a community
or nation or even internationally.
These four defects will be seen in the people if there is gold or wealth accumulated without
being used for devotional service.
So, Srila Prabhupada further says, according to Srimad Bhagavatam, gold encourages falsity,
intoxication, prostitution, envy and enmity.
This is what the Bhagavatam teaches.
If somebody accumulates gold and does not use gold for devotional service, such gold
encourages five things, falsity, intoxication, prostitution, envy and enmity.
Even a gold standard exchange in currency is bad.
Now Prabhupada is talking about the government policy.
Gold standard currency is based on falsehood because the currency is not on a par with
the reserve gold.
Now, that is the system most countries have including India that they have currency notes
issued by the government.
Now, what is the value of that currency note, the piece of paper?
Now, they say, the government says that this paper has got a value because it is valuable
because it is based on the reserve gold that is kept stored in the government safe deposit
vaults.
But, the reality is the government issues currency notes not exactly based on the value
of the gold stored in their vaults.
They issue much more currency notes than the gold there.
So, Prabhupada says the basic principle is falsity.
How gold encourages falsity is a good example here, right here.
The basic principle is falsity because currency notes are issued in value beyond that of the
actual reserve gold.
For example, if let us say the government has gold worth 100 crores.
The government has gold worth let us say 100 million rupees just to give you an example.
If the total currency notes in circulation, printed currency notes is more than 100 million
rupees, then that is a falsity and that is what exactly is happening.
So, Prabhupada says currency notes are issued in value beyond that of the actual reserve
gold.
So, there is falsity right here by the government itself.
See, the government should themselves not be practicing falsity and they should regulate
the citizens to avoid falsity.
Now, here government itself is not practicing falsity.
Government itself is practicing falsity when they issue currency notes beyond the value
of the reserve gold.
So, what happens if they issue such currency?
This artificial inflation of currency that means they are giving issuing more notes than
what they should be issuing.
This is called artificial inflation.
By the authorities encourages prostitution of the state economy.
The state economy is completely spoiled.
It is ruined.
The state economy is ruined.
What happens?
How is the economy ruined?
Prabhupada says the price of commodities becomes artificially inflated because of bad money
or artificial currency notes.
See, people have more currency notes in their hand than the actual reserve gold.
And the value of the goods that are available.
These currency notes are just a medium of exchange.
So, if I have currency notes worth let us say 10,000 rupees.
If these 10,000 rupees can purchase some goods worth what they say is worth 10,000, but if
the equation is not commensurate with actual total value of the goods then there is inflation,
artificial inflation in the price of the commodities.
The price of the commodities will go up because the supply of the goods will not correspond
with the supply of the currency notes.
There will be more currency notes in supply and the goods will be less.
So, what happens?
People's buying power will exhaust all the goods and people will have money but there
will be no goods.
So, the price of the commodities will naturally go up when there is scarcity.
Bad money drives away good money.
So, this is what is called as bad money.
The currency notes issued in excess of the value of the stored gold.
So, Prabhupada says instead of paper currency, actual gold coin should be used for exchange.
Whatever the government has got the reserve gold, they should make gold coins and that
should be the currency.
That should be the medium of exchange and this will stop the prostitution of gold.
Gold will not be misused anymore.
Gold ornaments for women may be allowed by control not by quality but by quantity.
What about women using gold ornaments?
That was always there in the Vedic culture.
So, now how can government avoid people accumulating too much gold in the form of gold ornaments
for women?
So, government has to regulate by quantity the gold that people possess.
Otherwise, if they possess too much of gold, that will simply lead to lust, envy, enmity,
etc.
So, by restricting the quantity of gold people can have, this will discourage lust, envy
and enmity.
When there is actual gold currency in the form of coins, the influence of gold in producing
falsity will automatically cease.
It will automatically stop.
Nobody can cheat.
If there are gold coins for currency, then nobody can cheat.
Neither the government nor the people can cheat.
Now, simply because they are issuing paper currency not in equality with the value of
reserve gold.
So, therefore, there is artificial inflation.
So, Prabhupada's recommendations are very practical and that is why you find in the
Vedic culture they had only gold coins.
They did not have currency notes in those times because of which there was no artificial
inflation at all.
Now, you can see in every country where they have currency notes, they have so much of
inflation.
So much of inflation.
The value of the currency notes which is promised by the government is not in on par
with the value of the commodities or the goods that people require to purchase with the money
that they have.
And that is why there is so much of inflation, inflation, inflation.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
My name is Mahatma Gandhi.
Thank you very much.
Excuse meâ€¦
